headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Got it. And just as a follow-up from the last resource question. Any implications and/or initial thought process around the proposed hike in the RPS?
componenttext: Got it. And just as a follow-up from the last resource question. Any implications and/or initial thought process around the proposed hike in the RPS?

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Nothing. I mean we'll see what happens. It's a proposal; commentary due by the end of November, and we'll see ultimately where that goes. On that subject though, obviously an increase then would give us more upside to CapEx, which is not really baked into
componenttext: Nothing. I mean we'll see what happens. It's a proposal; commentary due by the end of November, and we'll see ultimately where that goes. On that subject though, obviously an increase then would give us more upside to CapEx, which is not really baked into anything at this point.

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Michael Weinstein with Crédit Suisse.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Michael Weinstein with Crédit Suisse.

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Quick question about the economic conditions. It looked like they're steadily improving with each reporting period. I'm just wondering at what point do you think that translates into higher customer growth, higher load growth and, ultimately, higher rate
componenttext: Quick question about the economic conditions. It looked like they're steadily improving with each reporting period. I'm just wondering at what point do you think that translates into higher customer growth, higher load growth and, ultimately, higher rate base and everything else?

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: So as we continue to see a further solidification of the market, incremental new business, we expect that through the '16 to '18 you'll see a continual sort of upward slope in customer growth resulting in retail sales. And whether that -- what that means
componenttext: So as we continue to see a further solidification of the market, incremental new business, we expect that through the '16 to '18 you'll see a continual sort of upward slope in customer growth resulting in retail sales. And whether that -- what that means in terms of CapEx remains to be seen.

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Right. And do you -- can you comment at all on the headlines of recent, of late, regarding the election and everything else that might be happening out there?
componenttext: Right. And do you -- can you comment at all on the headlines of recent, of late, regarding the election and everything else that might be happening out there?

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Michael, there's -- as you point out, there's a lot of headlines both local and national and industry media. It is what it is. The election is not over with. You can get some pretty good reliable information at the Federal Election Commission website, the
componenttext: Michael, there's -- as you point out, there's a lot of headlines both local and national and industry media. It is what it is. The election is not over with. You can get some pretty good reliable information at the Federal Election Commission website, the Arizona Secretary of State website and pinnaclewest.com, our political participation policy.

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Ali Agha with SunTrust.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Ali Agha with SunTrust.

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: For the last 2 consecutive quarters, we've been seeing flat weather-normalized sales growth. Customer growth has been pretty consistent. Anything to read into that? Are we seeing more changes in usage patterns or too early? Or can you just comment on this
componenttext: For the last 2 consecutive quarters, we've been seeing flat weather-normalized sales growth. Customer growth has been pretty consistent. Anything to read into that? Are we seeing more changes in usage patterns or too early? Or can you just comment on this trend here?

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. No, we're not really seeing anything different in usage patterns per customer. Obviously, every residential customer that added from a new unit is going to use less energy than an equivalent one of 10 years ago. That's just the energy efficiency worl
componenttext: Yes. No, we're not really seeing anything different in usage patterns per customer. Obviously, every residential customer that added from a new unit is going to use less energy than an equivalent one of 10 years ago. That's just the energy efficiency world we're in, but we're up 0.3% for the year and in line with guidance.

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then if I look at that time line on the rate case process, as you laid out, it looks like if there is to be a settlement that January through March period would most likely be the time period before hearing but after all the staff and intervenor
componenttext: Okay. And then if I look at that time line on the rate case process, as you laid out, it looks like if there is to be a settlement that January through March period would most likely be the time period before hearing but after all the staff and intervenor testimonies come in?

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. So rate design, January 27. Hearing, March 22. That would be a window where a settlement could occur.
componenttext: Yes. So rate design, January 27. Hearing, March 22. That would be a window where a settlement could occur.

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Got it. And then this target that you guys have been working on that at a minimum you target to earn this 9.5% ROE. Should we assume that, that continues through this next 2-, 3-year cycle of CapEx that you've laid out for us? Is that still a good benchma
componenttext: Got it. And then this target that you guys have been working on that at a minimum you target to earn this 9.5% ROE. Should we assume that, that continues through this next 2-, 3-year cycle of CapEx that you've laid out for us? Is that still a good benchmark to think about going forward?

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, we filed for a rate case with a 10.5% ROE. So assuming we get decent outcome in the rate case that supports the longer-term growth of Ocotillo, Four Corners, SCR's, deferrals and so on, yes, that would be a good benchmark to think about.
componenttext: Well, we filed for a rate case with a 10.5% ROE. So assuming we get decent outcome in the rate case that supports the longer-term growth of Ocotillo, Four Corners, SCR's, deferrals and so on, yes, that would be a good benchmark to think about.

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Shar Pourreza with Guggenheim.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Shar Pourreza with Guggenheim.

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Let me just ask Mike's question slightly differently. It's been -- quarter after quarter you've seen an improvement in sort of the economic indicators and the jobs and the housing. So the question is, is really when do you think that'll transpire into sor
componenttext: Let me just ask Mike's question slightly differently. It's been -- quarter after quarter you've seen an improvement in sort of the economic indicators and the jobs and the housing. So the question is, is really when do you think that'll transpire into sort of your guidance, right, into your customer growth assumptions? Because right now, you're still at half -- 50 basis points to 150 basis points of growth. But what's the lag between what you're seeing from an economic standpoint to what you're seeing in your guidance?

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, our guidance '16 through '18 from a sales growth perspective is 0.5% sales on the sort of low end to 1.5% on the top end. And I think as history has shown us the last couple of years, slightly better improvement in customer growth and sales as we mo
componenttext: Well, our guidance '16 through '18 from a sales growth perspective is 0.5% sales on the sort of low end to 1.5% on the top end. And I think as history has shown us the last couple of years, slightly better improvement in customer growth and sales as we move through the time frame. So as I referenced earlier, with the sort of low vacancy rates in apartments and the low mortgage rates, you're seeing household formation of  25 to 34 begin to increase across the country. And that holds true for the Metro Phoenix area as well. So it's going to be better in '18 than it is this year. '17 should be better than '16. Exactly what that means, I think you have to look to our guidance.

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Charles Fishman with Morningstar.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Charles Fishman with Morningstar.

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Don, I just wanted you to clarify something that I'm confused about. You said the staff has recommended a new customer category or the rooftop solar customers should be in a partial requirements class, is that correct?
componenttext: Don, I just wanted you to clarify something that I'm confused about. You said the staff has recommended a new customer category or the rooftop solar customers should be in a partial requirements class, is that correct?

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. Jeff? I'll turn to Jeff to expand on that.
componenttext: Yes. Jeff? I'll turn to Jeff to expand on that.

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. Charles, so one of the findings that's right now in the recommended opinion in order is -- recognizes that customers, residential customers, with the rooftop solar are partial requirement customers. So it's similar to what we see on the commercial si
componenttext: Yes. Charles, so one of the findings that's right now in the recommended opinion in order is -- recognizes that customers, residential customers, with the rooftop solar are partial requirement customers. So it's similar to what we see on the commercial side where you've got a customer who brings their own generation. And we treat those folks differently on the commercial side than a customer that's a full-requirements customers. And so that's a helpful finding in that recommended opinion order because it reflects the nature of that customer's use.

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: So Jeff, that would lead you then -- I mean essentially, what the staff is saying is consistent with your proposal of having this demand piece for the rooftop solar people, correct?
componenttext: So Jeff, that would lead you then -- I mean essentially, what the staff is saying is consistent with your proposal of having this demand piece for the rooftop solar people, correct?

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: That's -- the argument we made is that these folks still use the demand side of the grid. And so if you look at a commercial customer, that's basically how we set the rate is to recover the demand, the cost of service that reflects the fact that they brin
componenttext: That's -- the argument we made is that these folks still use the demand side of the grid. And so if you look at a commercial customer, that's basically how we set the rate is to recover the demand, the cost of service that reflects the fact that they bring their own generation. And so again, this is going to be subject to discussion at the open meeting in December. And we're obviously getting ready for that conversation. But it's a helpful finding that just reflects the facts of the system.

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016

componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Paul Ridzon with KeyBanc.

componenttext: Just as a follow-up, has it been determined that they're going to be treated with demand charge? Or is that still open to discussion?

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: That's still open to discussion.
componenttext: That's still open to discussion.

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: And back to usage. Sometimes, we've seen extreme weather things kind of mess with people's weather norm models. Could that be going on here?
componenttext: And back to usage. Sometimes, we've seen extreme weather things kind of mess with people's weather norm models. Could that be going on here?

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: I mean it's possible. But really what we have is stronger commercial growth than we're seeing on the residential side, which is sort of supporting the sales growth as we sit here today. I always say weather is an art, not a science. But it wasn't so extre
componenttext: I mean it's possible. But really what we have is stronger commercial growth than we're seeing on the residential side, which is sort of supporting the sales growth as we sit here today. I always say weather is an art, not a science. But it wasn't so extreme like you would see in the shoulder month that you sort of tend to skew your degree days.

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Greg Gordon with Evercore.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Greg Gordon with Evercore.

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Sorry, I joined the call late. Did -- have you commented on the integrated resource plan? And then can you comment on it in any further detail? And as a part of the shortfall, would one of the potential solutions be to acquire some of the power blocks out
componenttext: Sorry, I joined the call late. Did -- have you commented on the integrated resource plan? And then can you comment on it in any further detail? And as a part of the shortfall, would one of the potential solutions be to acquire some of the power blocks out there? There's a lot of gas combined cycle sitting out there underutilized. And I know you probably don't need base load generation, but at the values you might be able to pay to get some of those power blocks even if they were used for intermediate or peaking, could that be a potentially good value proposition to solve those -- that shortfall?

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Greg, we -- I did cover in my remarks, and we've had a couple of questions on it. But we've shortlisted a number of resources. We expect to resolve it by the end of the year and announce our plan going forward. And beyond that, we're not going to -- we'd
componenttext: Greg, we -- I did cover in my remarks, and we've had a couple of questions on it. But we've shortlisted a number of resources. We expect to resolve it by the end of the year and announce our plan going forward. And beyond that, we're not going to -- we'd prefer not to get in any detail of where we're at now in the process. It's confidential.

headline: Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016

componenttext: We have no further questions at this time. I would now like to turn the floor back over to management for closing comments.
